message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL. 

The paper deals with a natural language processing task of retrieving relevant solutions for an input query by matching with historical tickets stored in a knowledge base. This task involves learning similarity in asymmetric text pairs, where the subject is a short text but description and solution are multi-sentence texts. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR), Computational Linguistics (cs.CL), and Machine Learning (cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL) sub-categories of arXiv CS.
